page.title: 13DISAPPEARING FARMS
page.content: Since World War 2 many farms have gone from Witham because of new houses,factories and the bypass being built. Farms that have disappeared include:- (1) Highfields Farm in Highfields Rd. used for housing..(2) Cuppers Farm .The house is a private house ,the fields used for houses of Stevens Rd.,Cuppers Close & Blunts Hall Rd(3) Freebournes Farm,Newland St.THe house remains used as three shops and the land is used for office blocks, housing, a Health Centre,and an industrial estate (4)The Howbridge Hall Estate had already been divided up into smallholdings , probably after W.W.1. All these are built over with houses (5) Little Elms farm house is now a pub, the land is a recreation ground and houses, as is Halfhides Farm and Cocks Farm. Motts Farm has been used for industrial development.
